name: James Njoroge
summary: I am an ambitious, diligent, and analytical student leader with a portfolio in software development, data analytics, and research, exemplified by outstanding academic performance and co-founding a student-run tech startup at Colgate University.

description.1: Develop and maintain strong and trustworthy relationships with professors and students to provide academic support and reinforcement.
description.2: Assist students with homework and lab assignments in Python and Java Programming languages.
description.3: Guide and debug students' work to strengthen their understanding of computer science concepts.
description.4: Provide one-on-one tutoring and serve as mentor for introductory Python/Java courses, and the Data Structures and Algorithms course.

description.1: Developed and maintained R Shiny applications for advanced statistical analysis of geospatial data, social networks, and textual corpora.
description.2: Collaborated with researchers on ongoing projects, utilizing R Shiny applications to evaluate hypotheses and extract insights from complex datasets.
description.3: Created user-friendly interfaces using R Shiny, making powerful R-based analyses accessible to diverse users without extensive programming knowledge.
description.4: Improved data science accessibility at Colgate University by creating interdisciplinary tools that bridge statistical modelling and researchers from diverse disciplines.

description.1: Conducted economic research on domestic violence and its effect on agricultural economics in Western Kenya.
description.2: Collaborated with professor to acquire and clean collected survey data using Microsoft Excel.
description.3: Examined research data for trends and anomalies in collaboration with a colleague, thus reducing the margin of error produced by the data.
description.4: Translated qualitative survey data from Swahili to English for easier analysis.
description.5: Supervised data collection and reviewed quality of collected data through field work.
description.6: Evaluated research and survey-taking methods, and recommended bias-reduction techniques.

description.1: Work in a customer-facing role on the phone and in-person.
description.2: Assist the campus community in the usage of technology on campus, including multi-factor authentication, Office 365 Apps, Adobe Software, and Google software.
description.3: Write detailed trouble tickets for users who have issues that need to be escalated to other departments.
description.4: Use Salesforce software to provide support and solutions to affected students, faculty, and staff in various departments.
description.5: Collaborate with a diverse team in a fast-paced atmosphere.

description.1: Worked within the sales team, selling our services and calling potential leads for attendance at the Marketer's Night in Nairobi and Marketer's Quiznite all over Kenya.
description.2: Used Excel and mail analytics to manage and execute the distribution of the Marketing Africa magazine all over Kenya.
description.3: Amalgamated the client database from various social media platforms using Microsoft Excel so as to broaden the reach of the company.
description.4: Collaborated with colleagues to ensure full customer satisfaction in the advertisement sector of the company.

description.1: Achieved a 20% throughput improvement by migrating a backend API from .NET Framework to .NET Core 1.1.
